<span style="color:black">Does Superintendent Selection Method Matter?</span> <img align="middle" src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Henryjean/Assignment3/master/Presentation/header.jpg" /> <span style="color:white">Ideas to change the world</span>

If you were in charge of searching for a new coach to lead the Manchester United Football Club, would you limit your search to only look for potential coaches that are from Manchester? Absolutely not. You'd look for the best canidate for the position regardless of where they came from. But in Mississippi School Districts this is exactly what is happening. 

Strangely enough, Mississippi is one of the only states in the country that elects a porition of their district superintendents. Of the 150 or so elected superintendents throughout the country, 63 of them are in Mississippi. 

Below is an interactive map that shows the 151 different school districts in Mississippi. The districts colored red are ones that elect their superintendent, while the one's colored green appoint their superintendent.

<p style='text-align: center;'>(63 of Mississippi's 151 Superintendents Are Elected - 43%)</p>

```{r, echo=FALSE, results='asis', warning=FALSE, error=FALSE, message=FALSE, cache=FALSE}
library(devtools)
SourceURL <- ("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Henryjean/Assignment3/master/DataAnalysis.R")
source_url(SourceURL)
```

## Test Score Distributions {.flexbox .vcenter}
```{r, results='asis', echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.align='center', cache=TRUE}
way <- ggplot(submelted, aes(value, color = factor(AorE)))
way + geom_density(aes(fill = factor(AorE)), alpha = .55) + facet_wrap(~ variable) + 
ggtitle("SATP Test Score Distributions") + scale_fill_manual(values = c("#009966", "#D1322D")) + theme(legend.title=element_blank()) + scale_color_manual(values = c("#009966", "#D1322D"))
```

## Graduation Rate Distributions {.flexbox .vcenter}
```{r, results='asis', echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.align='center', cache=TRUE}
gradrate <- ggplot(completeclean, aes(x = GradRate))
gradrate + geom_density(aes(fill=factor(AorE)), alpha =.75) +
ggtitle("Graduation Rates Distribution") + scale_fill_manual(values = c("#009966", "#D1322D")) + theme(legend.title=element_blank())
```

## Poverty Rate Distributions {.flexbox .vcenter}
```{r, results='asis', echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.align='center', cache=TRUE}
poverty <- ggplot(completeclean, aes(x = PovertyPct))
poverty + geom_density(aes(fill=factor(AorE)), alpha = .75) + scale_fill_manual(values = c("#009966", "#D1322D")) + theme(legend.title=element_blank()) + ggtitle("Poverty Rates Distribution")
```


## Enrollment Size Distributions {.flexbox .vcenter}
```{r, results='asis', echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.align='center', cache=TRUE}
EnrollmentDis <- ggplot(completeclean, aes(x = Enrolled100s))
EnrollmentDis + geom_density(aes(fill=factor(AorE)), alpha =.65) +
ggtitle("Enrollment Size Distribution") + scale_fill_manual(values = c("#009966", "#D1322D")) + theme(legend.title=element_blank())
```

## Regression Output {.flexbox .vcenter}
```{r, results='asis', echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, cache=TRUE}

library(stargazer)
stargazer(newgradfit, newmeanfit, newalg, newbio, newenglish, newhistory, type ='html', covariate.labels=c("Elected Superintendent", "Pct Students in Poverty", "Student-to-Teacher Ratio", "Enrollment", "Elected:Enrollment"))

```

## Modeling Graduation Rates {.flexbox .vcenter}
```{r, results='asis', echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, cache=TRUE}

stargazer(one, two, three, four, five, type = 'html', covariate.labels=c("Elected Superintendent", "Pct Students in Poverty",  "Student-to-Teacher Ratio", "Enrollment", "Elected:Enrollment"), column.labels = "Graduation Rates", omit.stat=c("f", "rsq", "ser"), digits = 2)


```
